section.title: Abstract
section.p: Custom contentCustom content is a pre-defined content portion (template) that can be inserted into your document through an associated button or a hot key.
To learn more about Custom Content, see , , , and .
For instructions on how to create a Custom Content template, see or proceed to the quick start example :
See example Creating a Command for emphasis Element Insertion.

example.title: Creating a Command for emphasis Element Insertion
example.p: Suppose you want to create a button that will insert emphasis elements, or wrap the selected content into the emphasis element. Do the following:

li.p: Insert the emphasis element to any valid place in your document.
Click Edit Custom Content New Custom Content .
The Custom Content DialogCustom Content Dialog will appear with the Content edit box containing: <emphasis role="bold"/>
Hit OK: a new Insert emphasis button will show up on the Custom Content Toolbar.

example.p: Now, if you hit this button the emphasis element will be inserted. If you select some content and hit this button, then the selected content will be wrapped into the emphasis element.

note.p: By default, every change made to the Serna GUI is not permanent: you should save it before you close the document. If you forgot to save changes, open the document from the recent file list: the GUI with your changes will be restored. For instructions on how to save the GUI view, see .
